dfischer.utils

Class LoadtestPluginContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.LoadtestPluginContext

  • public class LoadtestPluginContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides context data for load test plug-ins. Accessible when a plug-in is constructed, executed or deconstructed.
    See Also:
    GenericPluginInterface.TYPE_LOADTEST_EXEC

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONTEXT_SCOPE_GLOBAL
      The context contains only global information about the load test.
      static int CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP
      The context contains global information, per user specific information and per executed loop specific information.
      static int CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL
      The context contains global information, per user specific information, per executed loop specific information and specific information about the current URL call.
      static int CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER
      The context contains global information and per user specific information.

    • Field Detail

      • CONTEXT_SCOPE_GLOBAL

        public static final int CONTEXT_SCOPE_GLOBAL
        The context contains only global information about the load test. This context type is typical for plug-ins which are executed at global level (before or after a load test). Value = 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER

        public static final int CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER
        The context contains global information and per user specific information. This context type is typical for plug-ins which are executed at user level (before a user is created or after a user has been completed). Value = 2.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP

        public static final int CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP
        The context contains global information, per user specific information and per executed loop specific information. This context type is typical for plug-ins which are executed at loop level (before a loop has been started or after a loop has been completed). Value = 3.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

        public static final int CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL
        The context contains global information, per user specific information, per executed loop specific information and specific information about the current URL call. This context type is typical for plug-ins which are executed at URL level (before a URL has been called or after a URL has been called). Value = 5.

        Note: plug-ins which are constructed and executed at loop level will receive an upgrade of the context in case when a loop has been failed form CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP to CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL - accessible within the deconstructor of such plug-ins at loop level.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoadtestPluginContext

        public LoadtestPluginContext(java.lang.String prxVersion,
                     int prxCharEncoding,
                     HttpLoadTest httpLoadTest)
        Internal. Constructor for [global] plug-in context - called from the load test program.
        Parameters:
        prxVersion - Proxy Sniffer product version
        prxCharEncoding - the character set which is used by the generated load test program to read input data and to compare response content data: 1 = OS Default, 2 = ISO-8859-1, 3 = UTF-8
        httpLoadTest - reference to the load test program itself
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_GLOBAL

      • LoadtestPluginContext

        public LoadtestPluginContext(java.lang.String prxVersion,
                     int prxCharEncoding,
                     HttpLoadTest httpLoadTest,
                     int userNr)
        Internal. Constructor for [user] plug-in context - called from the load test program.
        Parameters:
        prxVersion - Proxy Sniffer product version
        prxCharEncoding - the character set which is used by the generated load test program to read input data and to compare response content data: 1 = OS Default, 2 = ISO-8859-1, 3 = UTF-8
        httpLoadTest - reference to the load test program itself
        userNr - the user number of the simulated user
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER

      • LoadtestPluginContext

        public LoadtestPluginContext(java.lang.String prxVersion,
                     int prxCharEncoding,
                     HttpLoadTest httpLoadTest,
                     int userNr,
                     HttpSocketPool socketPool,
                     CookieHandler cookieHandler)

        Parameters:

        prxCharEncoding - the character set which is used by the generated load test program to read input data and to compare response content data: 1 = OS Default, 2 = ISO-8859-1, 3 = UTF-8
        httpLoadTest - reference to the load test program itself
        userNr - the user number of the simulated user
        socketPool - the TCP/IP connection pool of the simulated user
        cookieHandler - the cookie pool of the simulated user
        See Also:

      • LoadtestPluginContext

        public LoadtestPluginContext(java.lang.String prxVersion,
                     int prxCharEncoding,
                     HttpLoadTest httpLoadTest,
                     int userNr,
                     HttpSocketPool socketPool,
                     CookieHandler cookieHandler,
                     HttpTestURL httpTestURL,
                     int threadStep)
        Internal. Constructor for [URL] plug-in context - called from the load test program.
        Parameters:
        prxVersion - Proxy Sniffer product version
        prxCharEncoding - the character set which is used by the generated load test program to read input data and to compare response content data: 1 = OS Default, 2 = ISO-8859-1, 3 = UTF-8
        httpLoadTest - reference to the load test program itself
        userNr - the user number of the simulated user
        socketPool - the TCP/IP connection pool of the simulated user
        cookieHandler - the cookie handler of the simulated user
        httpTestURL - the current URL call executed by the simulated user
        threadStep - the current execution step of the loop
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

    • Method Detail

      • getContextScope

        public int getContextScope()
        Returns the scope of the plug-in context.

        Notice: the scope which applied during construct/deconstruct of a plug-in can be different than the scope which is applied when the plug-in is executed.

        Returns:
        the scope of the plug-in context
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_GLOBAL, CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER, CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP, CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getPrxVersion

        public java.lang.String getPrxVersion()
        Returns the product version of the generated load test program.
        Returns:
        the product version of the generated load test program. Example: "V4.0-J"
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_GLOBAL, CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER, CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP, CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

        public int getPrxCharEncoding()
        Returns the character set which is used by the generated load test program to read input data and to compare response content data.
        Returns:
        the character set which is used by the generated load test program. 1 = OS Default, 2 = ISO-8859-1, 3 = UTF-8
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_GLOBAL, CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER, CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP, CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getUserNr

        public int getUserNr()
        Returns the actual number of the simulated user.
        Returns:
        the actual number of the simulated user. First user = 0, second user = 1 ..., or -1 if no such data is available
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_USER, CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP, CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getSocketPool

        public HttpSocketPool getSocketPool()
        Returns the user specific TCP/IP connection pool which is used for all URL calls when a user executes a loop.
        Returns:
        the TCP/IP connection pool, or null if no such data is available
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP, CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getCookieHandler

        public CookieHandler getCookieHandler()
        Returns the user specific cookie pool which is used for all URL calls when a user executes a loop.
        Returns:
        the cookie pool, or null if no such data is available
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP, CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • setLoopPassed

        public void setLoopPassed(boolean loopPassed)
        Internal. Marks an executed loop as passed or failed. This method is called from the load test program.
        Parameters:
        loopPassed - true = loop passed, false = loop failed
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP

      • loopPassed

        public boolean loopPassed()
        Returns if a loop has been passed or failed. Notice: this method must only be called from a plug-in deconstructor of a plug in which is constructed at loop level. In all other (unsupported) cases this method will always return false.
        Returns:
        true, if a loop has been passed and the method is called from a plug-in deconstructor and the plug-in is constructed at loop level, else false in all other cases.
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_LOOP

      • setHttpTestURL

        public void setHttpTestURL(HttpTestURL httpTestURL)
        Internal. Sets within the context the current URL call. This method is called from the load test program.
        Parameters:
        httpTestURL - the current URL call executed by the simulated user
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getHttpTestURL

        public HttpTestURL getHttpTestURL()
        Returns all data of the current URL call executed by the user (within a loop). This method will return only a valid result if the plug-in is executed at URL level (null in all other cases) - or called within a deconstructor of a plug-in which is constructed at loop level in case when a loop did fail.
        Returns:
        all data of the current URL call executed by the user, or null if no such data are available
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • setUrlPassed

        public void setUrlPassed(boolean urlPassed)
        Internal. Marks an executed URL as passed or failed. This method is called from the load test program.
        Parameters:
        urlPassed - true = URL passed, false = URL failed
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • urlPassed

        public boolean urlPassed()
        Returns if a URL call has been passed or failed. This method will return only a valid result if the plug-in is executed at URL level (null in all other cases) - and if the plug-in is executed after the URL call (returns false in all other cases).
        Returns:
        true if an URL calls has been passed.
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • markUrlAsFailed

        public void markUrlAsFailed(java.lang.String specificErrorMessage)
        Marks a URL call as failed. This method can be called from customized code within execute() and allows to release own plug-in specific errors which are flagged with the status type STATUS_TYPE_USER_SPECIFIC_TEST_FAILED.
        Note 1: plug-in specific errors are only considered if a) the plug-in is bound to a URL and b) the plug-in is executed after the URL has been called. This means that this method allows to turn a successfully passed URL call into an error.
        Note 2: the current loop of the simulated user will always be aborted when a plug-in specific error is released.
        Parameters:
        specificErrorMessage - plug-in specific error message.
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_USER_SPECIFIC_TEST_FAILED

      • markUrlAsFailed

        public void markUrlAsFailed(int specificErrorStatusType,
                   java.lang.String specificErrorMessage)
        Marks a URL call as failed. This method can be called from customized code within execute() and allows to release own plug-in specific errors which are flagged with an arbitrary status type.
        Note 1: plug-in specific errors are only considered if a) the plug-in is bound to a URL and b) the plug-in is executed after the URL has been called. This means that this method allows to turn a successfully passed URL call into an error.
        Note 2: the current loop of the simulated user will always be aborted when a plug-in specific error is released.
        Parameters:
        specificErrorStatusType - status type of the error
        specificErrorMessage - plug-in specific error message
         
        Programming Example: 
        
        // Intrinsic plug-in implementation.
        public void execute(Object context)
        {
                logVector = new LogVector();
                LoadtestPluginContext pluginContext = (LoadtestPluginContext) context;
 
                if (firstCall)
                {
                        // define plug-in specific error types
                        pluginContext.getPerformanceData().setErrorStatusTypeTranslation(HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_1, "No Connection to External Service");
                        pluginContext.getPerformanceData().setErrorStatusTypeTranslation(HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_7, "Internal Plug-In Error");
 
                        firstCall = false;
                }
 
                if (...)
                {
                        // report plug-in specific "red" error and terminate current loop of simulated user -> continue with next loop of simulated user
                        pluginContext.markUrlAsFailed(HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_1, "Plug-In Error Message Text A");
                }
 
                if (...)
                {
                        // report plug-in specific "red" error and terminate current loop of simulated user -> continue with next loop of simulated user
                        pluginContext.markUrlAsFailed(HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_7, "Plug-In Error Message Text B");
                }
        }
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_WRONG_HTTP_STATUS, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_WRONG_MIME_TYPE, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_WRONG_CONTENT_SIZE, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_NO_CONTENT_RECEIVED, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_CONTENT_STRING_NOT_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_STRING_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_USER_SPECIFIC_TEST_FAILED, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_HEADER_STRING_NOT_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_UNEXPECTED_HEADER_STRING_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_ABORTED_BY_INLINE_SCRIPT, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_0, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_1, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_2, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_3, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_4, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_5, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_6, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_7, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_8, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_9

      • getSpecificErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getSpecificErrorMessage()
        Internal. Returns the plug-in specific error message which was set by markUrlAsFailed(). This method is called from the load test program.
        Returns:
        the plug-in specific error message, or null if markUrlAsFailed() never was called.
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getSpecificErrorStatusType

        public int getSpecificErrorStatusType()
        Internal. Returns the plug-in specific error status type which was set by markUrlAsFailed(). This method is called from the load test program.
        Returns:
        the plug-in specific error status type.
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • setThreadStep

        public void setThreadStep(int threadStep)
        Internal. Sets the current execution step (index of URL call) within a loop. This method is called from the load test program.
        Parameters:
        threadStep - the current execution step within the loop, or -1 which means [no step] = no valid data
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getThreadStep

        public int getThreadStep()
        Returns the current execution step (index of URL call) within a loop. This method returns only a valid result if the plug-in is executed at URL level, or if the plug-in is deconstructed at the end of a loop which has failed.
        Returns:
        the current execution step within the loop, or -1 [no step] = no valid result
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • setContinueInnerLoopFlag

        public void setContinueInnerLoopFlag()
        Forces a simulated user to jump at the start of an inner loop.
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • setContinueInnerLoopFlag

        public void setContinueInnerLoopFlag(boolean continueInnerLoopFlag)
        Forces a simulated user to jump at the start of an inner loop.
        Parameters:
        continueInnerLoopFlag - true = jump at the start of an inner loop, false = no jump (default behavior)
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getContinueInnerLoopFlag

        public boolean getContinueInnerLoopFlag()
        Returns if a simulated user must jump at the start of an inner loop.
        Returns:
        true if a simulated user must jump at the start of an inner loop, false = no jump (default behavior)
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • setBreakInnerLoopFlag

        public void setBreakInnerLoopFlag()
        Forces a simulated user to jump out of an inner loop.
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • setBreakInnerLoopFlag

        public void setBreakInnerLoopFlag(boolean breakInnerLoopFlag)
        Forces a simulated user to jump out of an inner loop.
        Parameters:
        breakInnerLoopFlag - true = jump out of an inner loop, false = no jump (default behavior)
        See Also:
        CONTEXT_SCOPE_URL

      • getBreakInnerLoopFlag

        public boolean getBreakInnerLoopFlag()
        Returns if a simulated user must jump out of an inner loop.
        Returns:
        true if a simulated user must jump out of an inner loop, false = no jump (default behavior)
        See Also:
